intro: Limonium lacinium, commonly known as sea lavender, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of Europe and North Africa. It is characterized by its delicate blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer, typically from June to September. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often growing in salt-tolerant environments. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and aesthetic appeal. Limonium lacinium is also valued in floral arrangements for its long-lasting blooms and elegant appearance.
